result.execSummary:
The defendant Lah Tah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized.  Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment and treatment. Must be compliant with any child support or paternity orders in existence. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

records.addlTxt: Discharge - regular
Per RCSO, DNA collected - 08-04-2015 at 9:00 am

Defendant Lah Tah in court with attorney John Kenyatta Riley.  Defendant Lah Tah in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Karen interpreter appears via telephone and is sworn by the Court. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends 6 mos RCJ on 14CF993. On the other two charges, the state recommends 2 yrs probation on 14CF374. Defense does not believe additional jail time is necessary and asks that this Court leave open the possibility of expungement. The State strenuously opposes expungement - deft has received a substantial benefit. The State asks that the meth that was seized be donated to the K-9 Unit for purposes of training.

BTC: 14CF993- sent w/held - 2 yrs probation, consec to 15CF374, Ct 1.
         15CF374-Ct 1-6 mos RCJ/CFTS, costs, DNA costs. FAW/vote
                         Ct 2-sent w/held - 2 yrs prob conc w/14CF993

  **request for expungement is denied** The methamphetamine that was seized may be donated to the K-9 Unit for purposes of training. The State will draft an order

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA  sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment & treatment
Must be compliant with any child support or paternity orders in existence

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP
Sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lah Tah in court with attorney John Kenyatta Riley.  Defendant Lah Tah in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Karen interpreter appears via telephone-Sworn by the Court. Upon plea Ct 1 in 14CF993. The State recommends 2 yrs probation. Cts 2 & 3 are DRI. In 15CF374, deft will plead to Cts 1 & 2, Cts 3-5 are DRI. The State recommends 6 mos RCJ on Ct 1 and 2 yrs conc prob on Ct. 2
P-G to all
COP filed, rights given
deft waives right to JT-State stipulates to same
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Interpreter is not available. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ZCI

Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(g)-Possession of Methamphetamine; Ct 2: 961.41(3g)(e)-PCS/THC; Ct 3: 961.573(1)-Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lah Tah in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Interpreter Sweenersoe Thako, Karen Interpreter appears via telephone. Upon plea to Ct 1, rec 1 yr probation w/30 days RCJ conditional time. Mr. Tah has failed to provide clean ZCI sample. While that does not change the offer at this time, there may be bail jumping charges. Cts 1 & 3 are      . Although the State is not modifying its offer, this Court will not accept the offer based on the fact that deft has continued to consume narcotics, which is in direct violations of any bond this court granted you. Accordingly, the Court is revoking this bond and will reset bond.

BTC: Bond to be modified to $10,000.00 cash with same conditions as previously ordered. Defendant taken into custody. State will be issuing BJ charges.
                 Matter will track with new charges.
ZCI

The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lah Tah in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
Karin interpreter appears by speaker phone and is sworn.
State cannot proceed with plea hearing because there is not a clean ZCI report.  Defendant failed to report to ZCI after last court appearance, Jan 20.    It is the defense intention to accept the State's offer and enter a change of plea.  
State - based on Mr Barth's comments, State wants to make sure that defendant understands the ZCI requirement.
Court states requirement of ZCI after every court appearance.  That requirement is translated to the defendant.  
State moves for conversion of bond to cash.  
BTC:  1000 cash bond; same conditions  Plea hearing scheduled for 03-06-2015 at 11:00 am.

TAKEN INTO CUSTODY
